content: We may have this covered already and it is equally possible that we can't address this in our current scope for the IG going to ballot - but liquid biopsies are becoming a significant part of genomics.. this article points out some issues of how two different companies are presenting their information from a ligquid biopsy, which makes me think that we will need to allow a lot of leeway in any attempt to enable reporting of such results through our IG - https://www.360dx.com/liquid-biopsy/regulatory-documents-newly-approved-liquid-biopsy-ngs-panels-detail-diverse-test?utm_source=Sailthru&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=360Cancer%20Wed%202020-11-04&utm_term=360Dx%20Cancer%20Bulletin

@Arthur Hermann - Would you be willing to put together some examples based on what you see? My guess is we should be able to support at some/most of it, but was there something specific you were wondering about?

@Kevin Power I would like to look at a report from either, both of these companies so that we can ensure that our IG can appropriately handle the content.. if anyone has access to such reports that would help.. I can try to reach out to someone I know at Foundation. Again, my goal is to ensure that our IG can appropriately handle the information in the liquid biopsy reports
Once we find some examples, we can find out :smile:
I recently got contacted by Guarduant Europe. We are already using liquid biopsy in Heilbronn.
From my experience the data ist similar to tumor-normal-testing

Thanks @Patrick Werner . I am meeting with foundation tomorrow and should be able to provide a few more examples. Have you tried to develop a report for liquid biopsy of for any tumor testing using our FHIR IG? If so, can it handle all of the information in the samples you linked to?

I met with a few folks from Foundation Medicine and they provided two samples of their Liquid Cdx reports which I uploaded to our google drive repository. They can be found here:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Yww9xEuD9dneVE5ua-S5BcOi775NdY2f/view?usp=sharing
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1gvLx7iOIT2LFwi5w6-KcX6iA9cvkuldL/view?usp=sharing

They are also interested in joining our Genomics Working Group... either on a weekly basis, or at a minimum at one of our codethon's to use our IG in relation to their reports.. I will provide more information when I have it.

Quite a bit of time since we last discussed this, but I was reading through this thread and noticed that the FM liquid Cdx example links are broken. Any reason why? Did it change location, been deleted, or other?

Arthur Hermann said:

I met with a few folks from Foundation Medicine and they provided two samples of their Liquid Cdx reports which I uploaded to our google drive repository. They can be found here:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Yww9xEuD9dneVE5ua-S5BcOi775NdY2f/view?usp=sharing
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1gvLx7iOIT2LFwi5w6-KcX6iA9cvkuldL/view?usp=sharing

They are also interested in joining our Genomics Working Group... either on a weekly basis, or at a minimum at one of our codethon's to use our IG in relation to their reports.. I will provide more information when I have it.

Here is the link to our Example Report folder anyway:

https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/18T4RS0VnrJdLS3k79skbrZ0cYyL1U53t

May - I cannot find those documents either. I don't know where they went - however the best source for some sample Foundation reports is to go here: https://www.foundationmedicine.com/test/foundationone-cdx - then scroll down to "real world results" and you can see PDFs of various reports... I also added an "overview" document of Foundation Medicine reports in the repository which Kevin highlighted. Hope this helps
